discussion.title: Can't install PySR in conda on Windows due to an error with PyCall
discussion.body:
I have tried to install PySR in both Ubuntu and Windows. In Ubuntu i get some errors with python interpreter being statically linked to libpython, but it seems to work fine. In Windows, however, I have had no success installing PySR, as "python3 -m pysr install" yields the following error, which seems to have something to do with PyCall. Julia is installed and added to path, so I can't figure out how to fix this problem:

```powershell
(base) C:\Users\jbb>python3 -m pysr install
```

nodes.body:
It looks like there’s a permissions issue?
```
ERROR: LoadError: IOError: stat("C:\\Users\\jbb\\AppData\\Local\\Microsoft\\WindowsApps\\PythonSoftwareFoundation.Python.3.11_qbz5n2kfra8p0\\python.exe"): permission denied (EACCES) Stacktrace
```
Maybe python was installed with admin privileges or something, and Julia can’t access?
Also, you are installing everything with pip, not conda, right? There is no Julia for conda on Windows, and thus the PySR/PyJulia conda packages won't link to the correct one.
